verses.verse: Woe <S%H1945><s%> to the bloody <S%H1818><s%> city! <S%H5892><s%> It is all full <S%H4392><s%> of lies <S%H3585><s%> and robbery. <S%H6563><s%> The prey <S%H2964><s%> doesn't <S%H4185><s%> depart.

The noise <S%H6963><s%> of the whip, <S%H7752><s%> the noise <S%H6963><s%> of the rattling <S%H7494><s%> of wheels, <S%H212><s%> prancing <S%H1725><s%> horses, <S%H5483><s%> and bounding <S%H7540><s%> chariots, <S%H4818><s%>

the horseman <S%H6571><s%> mounting, <S%H5927><s%> and the flashing <S%H1300><s%> sword, <S%H2719><s%> the glittering <S%H1300><s%> spear, <S%H2595><s%> and a multitude <S%H7230><s%> of slain, <S%H2491><s%> and a great <S%H3514><s%> heap of corpses, <S%H6297><s%> and there is no end <S%H7097><s%> of the bodies. <S%H6297><s%> They stumble <S%H3782><s%> on their bodies, <S%H1472><s%>

because of the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of the prostitution <S%H2183><s%> of the alluring <S%H2896><s%> prostitute, <S%H2181><s%> the mistress <S%H1172><s%> of witchcraft, <S%H3785><s%> who sells <S%H4376><s%> nations <S%H1471><s%> through her prostitution, <S%H2183><s%> and families <S%H4940><s%> through her witchcraft. <S%H3785><s%>

"Behold, <S%H5002><s%> I am against you," says Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> of Armies, <S%H6635><s%> "and I will lift <S%H1540><s%> your skirts <S%H7757><s%> over your face. <S%H6440><s%> I will show <S%H7200><s%> the nations <S%H1471><s%> your nakedness, <S%H4626><s%> and the kingdoms <S%H4467><s%> your shame. <S%H7036><s%>
I will throw <S%H7993><s%> abominable filth <S%H8251><s%> on you, <S%H5034><s%> and make you vile, and will set <S%H7760><s%> you a spectacle. <S%H7210><s%>

It will happen that all those who look <S%H7200><s%> at you will flee <S%H5074><s%> from you, <S%H559><s%> and say, <S%H5210><s%> 'Nineveh is laid waste! <S%H7703><s%> Who will mourn <S%H5110><s%> for her? <S%H370><s%>' Where will I seek <S%H1245><s%> comforters for you? <S%H5162><s%>"

Are you better <S%H3190><s%> than No <S%H4996><s%> - Amon, <S%H527><s%> who was situated <S%H3427><s%> among the rivers, <S%H2975><s%> who had the waters <S%H4325><s%> around <S%H5439><s%> her; <S%H2426><s%> whose rampart was the sea, <S%H3220><s%> and her wall <S%H2346><s%> was of the sea? <S%H3220><s%>
Cush <S%H3568><s%> and Egypt <S%H4714><s%> were her boundless <S%H369><s%> strength. <S%H6109><s%> Put <S%H6316><s%> and Libya <S%H3864><s%> were her helpers. <S%H5833><s%>

Yet was she carried away. <S%H1473><s%> She went <S%H1980><s%> into captivity. <S%H7628><s%> Her young children <S%H5768><s%> also were dashed in pieces <S%H7376><s%> at the head <S%H7218><s%> of all the streets, <S%H2351><s%> and they cast <S%H3032><s%> lots <S%H1486><s%> for her honorable men, <S%H3513><s%> and all her great men <S%H1419><s%> were bound <S%H7576><s%> in chains. <S%H2131><s%>
You also will be drunken. <S%H7937><s%> You will be hidden. <S%H5956><s%> You also will seek <S%H1245><s%> a stronghold <S%H4581><s%> because of the enemy. <S%H341><s%>

All your fortresses <S%H4013><s%> will be like fig trees <S%H8384><s%> with the first-ripe <S%H1061><s%> figs: if they are shaken, <S%H5128><s%> they fall <S%H5307><s%> into the mouth <S%H6310><s%> of the eater. <S%H398><s%>

Behold, <S%H5971><s%> your troops in your midst <S%H7130><s%> are women. <S%H802><s%> The gates <S%H8179><s%> of your land <S%H776><s%> are set wide <S%H6605><s%> open <S%H6605><s%> to your enemies. <S%H341><s%> The fire <S%H784><s%> has devoured <S%H398><s%> your bars. <S%H1280><s%>

Draw <S%H7579><s%> water <S%H4325><s%> for the siege. <S%H4692><s%> Strengthen <S%H2388><s%> your fortresses. <S%H4013><s%> Go <S%H935><s%> into the clay, <S%H2916><s%> and tread <S%H7429><s%> the mortar. <S%H2563><s%> Make the brick kiln <S%H4404><s%> strong. <S%H2388><s%>

There the fire <S%H784><s%> will devour <S%H398><s%> you. <S%H2719><s%> The sword will cut you off. <S%H3772><s%> It will devour <S%H398><s%> you like the grasshopper. <S%H3218><s%> Multiply <S%H3513><s%> like grasshoppers. <S%H3218><s%> Multiply <S%H3513><s%> like the locust. <S%H697><s%>

You have increased <S%H7235><s%> your merchants <S%H7402><s%> more than the stars <S%H3556><s%> of the skies. <S%H8064><s%> The grasshopper <S%H3218><s%> strips, <S%H6584><s%> and flees away. <S%H5774><s%>

Your guards <S%H4502><s%> are like the locusts, <S%H697><s%> and your officials <S%H2951><s%> like the swarms of locusts, <S%H1462><s%> which settle <S%H2583><s%> on the walls <S%H1448><s%> on a cold <S%H7135><s%> day, <S%H3117><s%> but when the sun <S%H8121><s%> appears, <S%H2224><s%> they flee away, <S%H5074><s%> and their place <S%H4725><s%> is not known <S%H3045><s%> where they are. <S%H335><s%>

Your shepherds <S%H7462><s%> slumber, <S%H5123><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Assyria. <S%H804><s%> Your nobles <S%H117><s%> lie <S%H7931><s%> down. <S%H5971><s%> Your people are scattered <S%H6335><s%> on the mountains, <S%H2022><s%> and there is no one to gather them. <S%H6908><s%>

There is no healing <S%H3545><s%> your wound, <S%H7667><s%> for your injury <S%H4347><s%> is fatal. <S%H2470><s%> All who hear <S%H8085><s%> the report <S%H8088><s%> of you clap <S%H8628><s%> their hands <S%H3709><s%> over you; <S%H5674><s%> for who hasn't felt your endless <S%H8548><s%> cruelty? <S%H7451><s%>
